name: A long walk in the Chilterns, Central Chilterns

ai.summary: A challenging 70 km hike through the Central Chilterns in the UK, featuring rolling chalk hills, woodlands, and rural lanes. The route is demanding and best suited to experienced hikers with good navigation and endurance, potentially split over multiple days.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain includes rolling chalk hills, woodland trails, grassy tracks, farm lanes, and occasional muddy sections. Expect stiles, gates, and short ascents/descent along bridleways and footpaths in the Chilterns.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable weather, carry a map and compass or reliable GPS, and tell someone your itinerary. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Bring sufficient water and food, a first aid kit, a head torch, sun protection, a whistle, a charged phone with offline maps, and a lightweight emergency shelter. Navigation can be challenging in remote stretches; stick to waymarked routes when possible.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Layered clothing and waterproof, breathable outerwear
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit and blister care
Phone with offline maps and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; winter can be muddy with limited daylight and more challenging navigation.

seo.title: A 70 km Hard Hike Through the Chilterns – Central Chilterns, UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle a demanding 70 km hike across the Central Chilterns in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety, and gear to prepare for this challenging long-distance trek.
seo.h1: A 70 km Hard Hike Through the Chilterns (Central Chilterns, UK)
